column5: Introduction to the course: why and how designers can learn how to code simple things.
Generate graphics using cycles, store information into variables and use random generated values and noises
Create responsive sketches, reuse blocks of code stored into functions and learn the power of objects
Pimp your sketch with external sources and generate data driven graphics
Mouse, keyboard, voice and video: learn to communicate with your device and it will learn to communicate with you.
Multiple canvases, multiple pages and collaborative experiences: discover even more possibilities on the web.

column4: The outer space 3, Project Kick-off: Common Spaces
column5: Learn node.js, server side programming, and how to create collaborative sketches. Plus, introduction to the final delivery of the course.
Learn how to get the user's location and generate maps. Plus, a recap of past lessons and a quick review and assessment on first drafts for the final delivery.
Learn to interact with mobile devices
Review and assessment on first drafts for the final delivery.
Explore the three dimensional space on a two dimensional surface.
Exam day: present your final delivery in front of the class.
Present your final work: live presentation and repository
